page.title: 08WORK IN GRIMSBY & CLEETHORPE
page.content: {Jobs}linked with{fishing}have declined as the amounts of fish caught have contracted.There are relatively{few {fishermen,lumpers(unloaders of fish) and{filleters.}A considerable employer now is the{frozen food industry;} Grimsby being the largest centre in the world for frozen food production and cold storage.Household names such as Ross,Findus and Bird's Eye have large factories near the docks.Smaller concerns,including{Icelandic}and {Faroese}companies concentrate on {frozen fish}products.{Industrial {estates}have been developed in areas where old terraced housing has been demolished,giving rise to a range of {light industries}such as food processing,engineering,packaging. In Cleethorpes the{tourist industry provides mainly{seasonal work}in hotels and leisure facilities.
